title.narrative: Arab Theater Training Center ATTC Home Arts Homecoming Project (HAHP) 2021 -2022
Arab Theater Training Center ATTC Home Arts Homecoming Project (HAHP) 2021 -2022

description.narrative: Objective of the intervention: The objective of the intervention is to “Enhance and strengthen the resilience of Syrian communities and build the capacity of key cultural actors to withstand crises, practice, and defend freedom of expression”. The intended impact of the project is outlined as “The ability of refugee and displaced communities in Syria, Jordan & Lebanon (with focus on women, children, youth, and performing artists) to cope and deal with the ongoing crisis is enhanced through the use of culture and art”. ATTC also states that as a consequence of enhanced resilience, the refugees will have opportunities to express themselves in the countries where they live and develop positive relations with their host countries. According to ATTC, the project will contribute to “build the capacity of key cultural actors to withstand crises, practice and defend freedom of expression using art as a tool of change and support”. With the project the aim is also to explore new prospects to support Syrian artists in their homeland and in Diaspora. It also encourages intercultural dialogue between Syrian and non-Syrian performing artists, creating a connecting point between artists and development actors. The project also aims to develop a stronger Syrian identity as a peace building component in Syria, as well as a to enhance social cohesion in the host countries as a source of conflict mitigation. The project has two main outcomes; 1) Psycho-social support & empowerment to affected Syrian refugees and their host communities provided & enhanced using arts & culture. And 2) The capacity of the independent performing arts sector as an effective force for community building and social cohesion strengthened. For the outcome 1) the ATTC has outlined three outputs; 1.1) Create a Digital Archive for Syrian refugee stories. Collection, documentation, and dissemination of Syrian refugee stories in Syria. 1.2) Syrian children and youth acquiring skills for audio visual production, drama, and interactive theatre. 1.3) Organise different types of encounters between Syrian refugees and artists and their host communities in a variety of settings. For the outcome 2) the ATTC has outlined four outputs; 2.1) Productions and performances by independent artists inside Syria in the face of the ongoing crisis enabled. 2.2) Productions & performances in Lebanon by Syrian and local artists enabled. 2.3) Tailored, specialized training and mentorship of independent artists inside and outside Syria strengthened, and 2.4) Communication, Networking and Visibility to promote and strengthen future performing arts projects in Syria and host communities. The EoS assessed the objective of the project to be in line with the theory of change and the planned outcomes and respective activities as relevant and realistic.

Sida represented by the Embassy of Sweden in Beirut (EoS), and the Arab Theater Training Center (ATTC) with main office in Beirut, Lebanon, will enter into agreement for the period 2021-2022 to support the Home Arts Homecoming Project (HAHP).
Home Arts Homecoming project (HAHP) aims to enhance and strengthen the resilience of Syrian communities and build the capacity of key cultural actors to withstand crises, practice and defend freedom of expression using art as a tool of change.
The planned activities are: 1. Provide psycho-social support and empower affected Syrian refugees and their host communities using arts and culture, 2. Enhance the capacity of the independent performing arts sector as an effective force for community building and social cohesion strengthened, and for playing a role for the development of the cultural sector and freedom of expression in a future Syria, 3. Improve Networking and creating synergies with similar initiatives, 4. Initiate the mapping of emerging talents inside and outside Syria, and 5. Focus on creating more platforms for Syrian artists inside Syria in order to extend opportunities not afforded by projects already launched by other cultural institutions.

Sida representerade av svenska ambassaden i Beirut, och Arab Theatre Training Center (ATTC) med huvudkontor i Beirut, Libanon, har ingått avtal för perioden 2021-2022 för stöd av projektet Home Arts Homecoming Project (HAHP). HAHP syftar till att stärka och bygga upp kapaciteten hos syriska kulturaktörer i diaspora. Målet är att tillämpa yttrandefriheten med hjälp av konst som ett verktyg för demokratisk förändring i Syria. De planerade aktiviteterna är: 1. Psykosocialt stöd till syriska flyktingar -och deras värdsamhällen- med hjälp av konst och kultur. 2. Förbättra den oberoende scenkonstens kapacitet som ett effektivt medel för samhällsbyggnad och yttrandefriheten i framtida Syrien. 3. Skapa synergier mellan kulturaktörer i regionen 4. Kartlägga syriska kultur talanger, och 5. Skapa fler kulturarenor för syriska konstnärer.
